body_html:
1. It is discouraged to install python modules with super user privileges. It can run arbitrary code on your computer, and it can be compromised just because you've made a typo in the package name. Use virtualenv or conda environments.
  2. It's probably caused by mismatch between your pip and python commands (i.e. pip is actually coming from a different Python executable).

This looks more like a problem with configuration of your environment, so I'll close this, but you can always post questions on our forums.
body_text:
It is discouraged to install python modules with super user privileges. It can run arbitrary code on your computer, and it can be compromised just because you've made a typo in the package name. Use virtualenv or conda environments.
It's probably caused by mismatch between your pip and python commands (i.e. pip is actually coming from a different Python executable).

This looks more like a problem with configuration of your environment, so I'll close this, but you can always post questions on our forums.
body:
1. It is discouraged to install python modules with super user privileges. It can run arbitrary code on your computer, and it can be compromised just because you've made a typo in the package name. Use `virtualenv` or conda environments.
2. It's probably caused by mismatch between your `pip` and `python` commands (i.e. `pip` is actually coming from a different Python executable).

This looks more like a problem with configuration of your environment, so I'll close this, but you can always [post questions on our forums](http://discuss.pytorch.org).
